intro: Pavetta dissimilis, commonly known as the African snowbell, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy white or pale blue flowers that resemble bells, typically arranged in clusters. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Pavetta dissimilis thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
